key_title: Key to the species of Lomatia

Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Proteaceae

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Proteaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1996). Proteaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves glabrous or almost so on both surfaces; tepals more or less glabrous
Leaves glabrous on upper surface, pubescent and yellowish or rusty below; tepals densely pubescent on outside
Leaves ovate to lanceolate or oblong-elliptic, usually less than 4 times as long as broad, long-petiolate, margins coarsely and pungently toothed; widespread shrub to 1 (–2) m high

Leaves linear to narrowly oblong to lanceolate, usually more than 8 times as long as broad, sessile or very shortly petiolate, margins with a few distant teeth to almost entire; large shrub or small tree 3–5 m high, mostly riparian
